intro: Desmos stenopetalus, commonly known as the narrow-petaled desmos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub with compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale yellow. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
